div.head: Esju
div.p: Esju Oy is a high-technology company established in 1991. Our area of business comprises electronics design, consulting, research, training, and EMC laboratory services. We offer a diverse range of telecommunications R&D services. We are specialized in designing digital and radio components for base station equipment and integrating them into small spaces. We develop our products with an eye on their entire life cycle and we utilize state-of-the-art technology in all of our projects. Our expertise in designing personal healthcare devices offers excellent possibilities for long-term cooperation with our customers Role in the project: Esju's role in Health^5G is first and foremost in combining 5G telecommunications solutions with innovative health devices.

div.head: Experts involved:
div.p: Mr. Kauko Heinikoski received his M.Sc degree from University of Oulu in 2000. Currently he is working as Senior Specialist in Esju Oy. He has work history in telecommunication business (Nokia and Ericsson) working with macro to small cell base station products. His current research interests is to look for 5G enabled innovative health and base station solutions.

Mr. Timo Tarvainen received his PhD degree from University of Oulu in 1999. Currently he is working as a Technology Director in Esju Oy and looking for new opportunities for Esju Oy in health and telecommunications business areas. He has extensive work history in telecommunications applications relating to RF and EMC. His current research interests include future solutions for base stations as well as combining innovative health solutions to emerging telecommunications technologies.

Involvement in work packages: 2, 4, 5 and 6 -Development of innovative health care device demonstration with 5G. The aim is to select and demonstrate a challenging solution that needs special skills in telecommunications and algorithm development.

div.head: Inova DE, GmbH
div.p: Company profile: Inova DE GmbH is registered in Heidelberg, Germany since December 2013 as an individual company, and as GmbH since September 2015. We partnered with the company INOVA+ with offices in Oporto, Lisbon, Brussels and Warsaw that help us to increase our range and rate of market penetration.

Inova DEs core business is research and development in the medical area. Inova DE develops software and hardware for multiple applications in medicine and healthcare, working close with medical doctors of different specialties and end-users of our development results. With this close cooperation we achieve the highest degree of usability and user satisfaction. Prior successful research results include the EUROSTARS CAST Project in which we bring the resulting cardiology telemedicine platform into this consortium. . Other projects in which Inova DE is involved includes innovations in the fields of oncology, 3D Printing of organ models, automated solutions for hospital logistics, Web platform for Ambient Assisted Living and Orthopedic Robots. The Inova DE personnel are experts in medical software development following the appropriate norm (DIN EN 62304), with over five years of experience in the R&D field.

Role in the project: The development of cardiology platform for safe communication between patient and cardiologist is the main purpose and role of the company in this project. The goals of this project are in line with our interests in both the scientific field, as well as the economic field. The development tasks of Inova in the proposed project is mostly found on Workpackages 2 and 3 where we will adapt the existing on-line platform to integrate new the consortium developments in terms of secure and safe data transmission through all the communication channels between the patient and the cardiologist, including the increase of usability through the [video]-chat option through the platform. Our participating on dissemination of results, business development and market and product research further complete our engagement in the project.

div.head: Experts involved:
div.p: Vitor Vieira (Gender: m) is a Doctorate in Medical Robotics through the University of Heidelberg (2010) and Electrotechnic Engineer by the Faculty of Engineering University of Porto. He is experienced in image processing, technical and software development in particular in medical robotics and software. He has over six years of experience in the medical industry as Software Development Manager, and safety inspector for the medical device manufacturer Precisis AG. He has been trained in medical software development norm (DIN 62304) as well as Quality Management (DIN 13485) and Risk management (DIN 14971). Due to his background experience in the fields of medical innovation in the last decade he has also been an active participant on the following projects: 3D PRIME (3D PRInting for Medical Education and training) -Eurostars; POPE (PseudO Progression Entscheidungsunterstüzungssystem) -ZIM; CAST (CArdiac measuring Shirt for Telemedicine) -Eurostars; SPARTA (Software Platform for Adaptive Multimodal Radio and Particle Therapy with Autarkic Extendibility) -BMBF; ASCAS (Automated Seed-Catheter Assembly System) -Eurostars; iDeepBrain-ZIM; AssRob Tool Instrumentor -Echord; Assistant Robot-ZIM; Compusurge -FP7.

Isabel Boldt (Gender: f) is a BSc in Management and Information Systems by University Portucalense Infante D. Henrique (2008). She is experienced in requirements analysis, software design, software tests, user training and helpdesk. She has two years of experience in the bank industry as IT Consultant and five years in medical projects as a researcher. She also worked on a research project aimed to contribute to the improvement of health data availability at the point of care (OPTIM -Optimizing Information Systems for healthcare improving Graphical User Interface and Storage Management through Machine Learning techniques on user logs data). She worked on this project during two years in which she gained useful insight into the medical user field and their necessities. In her latest project she worked with medical doctors making software tests, user training and helpdesk with the goal of integrating all the medical software with the hospital information system (HIS). It was implemented several hospitals of northern area of Portugal. Currently she is working on Inova DE as functional analyst and developer on the CAST (CArdiac measuring Shirt for Telemedicine) project.

Arbër Qytyku (Gender: m) has studied Physics at the University of Geneva, Switzerland. He is experienced in software development and project management. During his work at Protik ICT resource center in Tirana, Albania, he has managed several student development teams in different IT projects. He has worked in data analysis with python scipy and C++, and architected software running on Amazon Cloud. He has 1 year experience as project manager and 5 years' experience in software development.

div.head: Labrox
div.p: Labrox is a privately-owned Finnish instrument design and manufacturing company, founded 2011. We specialize in design, development and manufacturing of multimode plate reader platforms, detection systems, instrument modules and components.

We offer top quality turnkey multimode analysers. Our long history with detection systems, mechanics, electronics, software and analyser development guarantees that our partners will receive instrument solutions meeting the highest standards.

div.head: Company profile:
div.p: Accellrate Mobile Infrastructure AB (hereafter Accellrate) is an independent professional telecom company eager to innovate the telecom industry. As a small SME, we combine our management and technology expertise with a financial perspective in order to help you streamline and prepare customers infrastructure for the future challenges of the industry. Accellrates strength is the combination of technical, business and financial perspective. The senior expertise who advise customers within all three areas. The scope to cost optimise telecom investments and find innovative solutions to simplify everyday life. Accellrate has expertise knowledge in Radio site infrastructure.

div.head: Role in the project:
div.p: The role in the project as from an SME perspective, support the project needs with communication expertise. Accellrate will also support the use case in the project, by contributing with research on product development and solutions for eHealth scenario. The goal is to enable new technology and to exploit this technology in future business and market. The special expertise on beacons and tracking devices will benefit the project.

div.head: Experts involved:
div.p: Patrik Sivermalm -He is Engineer in Telecommunications and has also a Diploma in Business communications. He has an extensive experience from the telecom market. Over the years he has been working in both SME and in the larger companies such as the major OEM Ericsson AB. His role in Ericsson was to support all management levels both in R&D, Product management and as Business owner. Today he is the owner of the SME Accellrate with focus in telecom challenging the bigger players for network solutions and business models.

div.head: Alten
div.p: Company profile: Alten Sweden (hereafter 'Alten') is a consultancy company in engineering and IT. ALTEN, the European leader in engineering and technology consulting, provides support for its clients' development strategies in the fields of innovation, R&D and it systems. At Hotswap department we have a strong passion for life science technology. We are an engineering consultancy company active in the life cycle of products -from Concepts & innovations, through Design, Verification & validation, Production setup & process validation, to Product maintenance & support. We have been in this business for more than a decade and have successfully completed more than 600 projects in this field. Alten is today twenty-five thousands engineers, dedicated to its role to support the customer. With global access via local offices the company is represented with experts where needed. Its top engineers carry out studies and conception projects for the technical and information systems

Green Communications

Green offers a solution that combines these different paradigms including a participatory Internet product. As part of the project, Green Communications will continue its standardization effort through the IETF.

div.head: APPENDIX 2: EXPLOITATION PLANS
div.p: VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland (VTT) provides research services to industry and the public sector. Participating in Health^5G, will improve VTT's competitiveness and competence in the field of future health services utilizing 5G technologies. Especially VTT is working in the fields of wireless communication, edge computing, network slicing, sensor and data fusion, data analysis (related to health and network technologies), and modelling of digital transformation. VTT will also utilize their 5G test network, and offer that as a piloting and validation environment for project partners, and customers.

div.head: Åbo Akademi
div.p: The results obtained in this project will be used both for research and technology transfer. Research wise, the results will allow ÅA to establish itself as a competence center in the topic, both at national and international level. This will allow us to attract more local and foreign students and increase our collaboration with local industry. The new master's theses and doctoral dissertations will be created and the results of the work will be published in the renown forums and periodicals. New course content and training materials will be developed based on the results of the project and provided not only to students but also to national companies.

div.head: Experis IT
div.p: has focused from the beginning on the provisioning of advanced solutions for IT services, specializing in creating big data architectures, designing and developing data collection systems, and implementing advanced data analytics and computational modelling applications, aimed at increasing services value in any market sector or industrial area. EXPERIS is involved in several eHealth projects such as ECOMODE (H2020 2014) or NETMD (RETOS COLABORACIÓN 2015) in which it has gained expertise on data gathering and processing particularities related to eHealth and wellbeing problematics. Also, regarding Data Analytics technology, EXPERIS has developed projects aimed at infrastructures management where heterogeneous data is collected from IoT sensors, processed and used to extract optimisation recommendations and to perform infrastructure management, such as SENERSIS (EEA GRANTS) or commercial project GITRA. EXPERIS has a great variety of clients from different industrial sectors with very specific technological needs. This project will enable EXPERIS to continue developing and improving its knowledge and expertise in IT infrastructure development and Data Analytics solutions implementation tailored to specific industrial sector's needs. Thus, it will increase its technological leadership and allow EXPERIS to continue its market diversification. Given EXPERIS 's background in commercial projects, it has a broad customer base that will enable it to exploit project's results. Regarding GITRA project (one of the main important services in terms of economic impact for the company), EXPERIS has great interest in continue gaining expertise in architecture development and Data Analytics technologies, expertise that will be able apply to infrastructure management field and therefore position itself as a leader on this field. The main client for this commercial project is a Spanish telco operator, Telefonica, that is willing to continue enlarging and improving GITRA solution capabilities and performance. Besides, EXPERIS is currently involved in NETMD project which will result in an eHealth platform aimed at monitoring movement disorders, and which is planning to commercialize in the comming years (it is currently under testing phase by clinical experts), allowing it to enter in eHealth market. Thus, developing this project will help EXPERIS to reinforce its position in eHealth market penetration, becoming a reference creating complex IoT architecture for coming eHealth market.

UAB plans to exploit the results of this project through high quality scientific contributions (publications, conferences, code) that demonstrate achieved results. This will lead to increase out technology transfer activity to industries specially those involved in implementing medical devices. The project will also provide a unique opportunity to cover the complete data chain explore data for specific the use cases. The scientific results and the final platform will also provide teaching labs with the most advanced technology and applications to do research in this domain. In addition the project methodology and the technologies that will be implemented as well as the outputs will be used in the academic curriculum as for instance the new born master on Internet of Things for eHealth that will start next by 2018 at our university.

Pulso has a strong expertise on developing projects between public and private health sector. We will promote and disseminate the project outcomes to all stakeholders (customers, users, sponsors, etc) with special focus on the promotion on the use cases defined in the Project. The project will help us to identify new market opportunities based on the defined use cases and technology developed together with our partners on the project. We have a great opportunity to grow together in other European countries with strong collaboration with the project partners: this is one of the main reasons to participate on this project; business grow in the service/product portfolio with the support of international organizations. We are an SME with limites acces to international markets and this Project will definitely contribute to our international business development. Quobis will integrate the project results in its current WebRTC solutions portfolio, as part of the Sippo solution which is mainly targeted to service providers, financial, insurance and healthcare institutions. Sippo is a webserver and backend solution that helps to integrate WebRTC applications in existing VoIP or NGN/IMS networks, managing topics like authentication, authorization, accounting, user provisioning, user privileges, etc. This project will help to improve the Sippo solution by the addition of new multimedia features and interfaces to integrate new communication services based on HEALTH5G results. The participation in the use case will help to identify ad-hoc features to fit the solution in the eHealth market.

Televes: particularly for Televes, the advantages of the proposed solutions the design of a new 5G gateway, as an intelligent element that allows interaction with different communication technologies and services. The proposed system will also have a differential user interface that guarantees the accessibility and allows the integration of different platforms depending on the user's needs. Some of the tele-care devices and platform's manufacturers are also providers of existing platforms aimed at monitoring chronic diseases. However, these solutions are completely isolated from the social dimension. In recent years, social and economic changes have provoked enormous interest and the potential older people's needs are met with high quality:

-Costs of care are maintained at reasonable levels for society -New market opportunities for products and services based on ITCs are opened However, according to the Commission (COM (2007) 332 final, p.3) this market is still at an early stage and not fully ensures the ability to provide appropriate solutions in the future. Although there is a wide range of devices and systems, arising from the promotion held in Europe for the last years it has been detected that:

-Users' needs have not been understood efficiently -No market has been developed; suppliers and users have no visibility of relevant solutions -There are technical, legal and infrastructure barriers Those issues have been considered in our approach and will be demonstrated through this proposal, as a result, access to the market will be facilitated. Televes is headquartered in Santiago de Compostela, Galicia, where the Regional Innovation Strategy for Smart Specialization (RIS3) sets as one of the main challenges to position the region as a benchmark in Southern Europe in providing knowledge-intensive services and products related to active ageing and a healthy lifestyle. Televes is a well-established technology provider with the objective of increasing its presence in the Telehealth/telecare market. The generated synergies with service providers will not only benefit the Quality of Life of the Living Areas' citizens but also will contribute to the sustainability and efficiency of the public health and social services. In order to provide a figure about the number of potential users, UN predicts that by 2050, one-third of the populations in developed countries will be aged 60 or older: around 700M people. EUROPOP predict 124 million EU citizens will be more than 65 years old in 2030, 42% more than today. According to Frost&Sullivan, the European market posits remote patient monitoring as achieving $616.4 million in 2012 and rising to $831 million by 2018. Berg Insight report, says that connected care revenues in Europe will reach €4.8 billion by 2019. Only in Spain, (according to SANIMarket) there were more than 880K users in 2014. Televes moderate estimates state that with the partnership with service providers, after a successful project results, will be able to increase its turnover in 2,5M€/year (5.000 users) in 2017, ramping-up to 25M€ (50.000 users) in 5 years. The Return of Investment in 5 years for the operation, based in the industry standard would be 25%. Televes manufactures design, develops in Europe, so the employment associated with this initiative in the short term (5-10 people) will be generated in Europe.

The main selling channels are: Public authorities, local/global service providers, etc. Current specific Websites for telecare will also inform about the new solution and services, and telemarketing to attract users to the new solution and services offered. During this project three main elements will be tested or developed: 5G Gateway, InPatientContextSensor and ECG.

div.head: BundlesLab Ltd:
div.p: The project will open new perspectives to our company. The software solutions to be developed by the company within the project will be based on both 5G technology and WebRTC technology in order to enable the development of application for various platforms including web-and mobile applications. The project outcomes will be added to the company solutions and presented to our customers and partners with the special focus on stakeholders related to healthcare sector. It will allow us to find new business opportunities and promote the project outcomes.

div.head: Kookmin University:
div.p: The implemented OCC based system will be used for 5G eHealth system. It will provide a secure patient monitoring system in hospital, ambulance, home, and disables persons in outdoor wheel chair. Our technology will provide reliable connectivity based on OCC, for (i) body sensor/patch-to-camera/smart phone connectivity and (ii) camera/smart phone-to-gateway connectivity. We can offer remote monitoring as well as remote surgery using our proposed technology. We have collaboration with several companies who will commercialize the product based on our technology. Our achieved results will be disseminated through seminar, workshop, conference, journal publications, and patent registration.

HUFS will cooperate with service providers and network operators to utilize the project outcome and realize the developed eHealth services. In particular, we will integrate mCCN-based 5G technologies with eHealth services to better support and care for patients in various environments, which will lead to new market opportunities in the area of eHealth.

H3 System is going to utilize this project to upgrade the current H3's tele-medicine system, especially, communication devices for remote patient monitoring services. The current versions are based on 2G, 3G, and 4G. This project can help H3 System to easily migrate the tele-medicine system to 5G based system. And the new system can have more valuable features specifc to 5G networks.

LifeSemantics is a company developing exchange technology of medical information via PHR (Personal Health Record). LifeSemantics also deals with the latest medical technologies on rehabilitation by smart devices which can be improved in several ways through 5G eHealth environment. In case on hospital, we will develop state of the art medical information exchange technology via FHIR on HL7 layer. We also develop home healthcare service through ISO 27001, ISO 27799, ISO 27017. In case on healthcare service at home, we want to apply artificial intelligence based on vast volume of medical data through 5G environment. Through 5G environment, we can access data faster including medical image and DNA WGS data which can support precision medicine. We finally study on precision medicine application based on Life-log data and DNA data.

LiveU within the Health5G project will develop multilink technology over and perhaps within the 5G network, that would enable the network and the devices to use multiple networks at the same time, and increase the stability, and smoothness of the service. The multiple networks are used today for broadcasting live videos, and the technology originally developed by LiveU at the application layer proving the need and benefits, now the technology shall find its way to health care services, hiding that functionality from the content provider. Within the scope of the project, we will implement and demonstrate the multilink benefits for crisis/emargency situations or others, These approaches would directly target the potential requirements for health care segment in '5G' ENFORMA is a data analytics company. Enforma's TÜBİTAK Marmara Teknokent technopark settlement is also active in providing consultancy to telecommunications companies' projects such as Netaş (vendor), TurkNet (operator) and Plusclouds (data centre) . Over time, Enforma has shown to collaborate with Turkcell Teknoloji and Memorial Healthcare Group. Enforma's owner, Dr Bulut is also an associate professor at Okan University which successfully operates a number of university hospitals under the Okan brand. All these strengthen our chances of proposer exploitation. Last but not the least having one foot in academia strongly suggests that the findings of this project will find a dissemination path in the form of academic articles, too.

Inova DE, GmbH will promote the exploitation and dissemination of the results and prepare for future commercialization. Throughout the whole duration of the project, supporting dissemination material will be prepared and presented on relevant channels, conferences and workshops in order to raise awareness to the project objectives and product. We intended we will as early as possible publish relevant information to produce an early market interest. The prototype will be also presented in different occasions and it will seek to secure future stakeholders for the project and product. We also intend to acquire market research data because we can easily identify new market opportunities based on the defined use cases and technology developed. We believe in this way we have a great opportunity to grow in other European countries.

Turkcell Teknoloji: 5G differs from its predecessors by serving a broad range of applications with varying delay, bandwidth and reliability requirements using the same infrastructure. Operators are preparing to transform their network for 5G into a platform where innovative services can be launched with minimal effort and easily scaled. Turkcell positions itself as a digital operator in the region. eHealth is a vertical that is gaining rapid traction. Turkcell plans to exploit HEALTH^5G project results in understanding health sector specific requirements and how to customize its 5G infrastructure based on this sector's needs. HEALTH^5G will also investigate new e-health use cases and business models that use the novelties 5G technologies introduce. Turkcell can exploits these findings in creating new services for its customers.

Institut-Mines Telecom will exploit the results of this highly collaborative project in order to perform cutting-edge research, have good scientific output (e.g., publications in top-venues, research presentations, open-source code) and demonstrate their achievements. This leads to an enhancement of their research profile, increased funding opportunities form Industry and Government bodies (e.g., EU/National programs) and also helps attract top class students and staff. The project will provide academic partners like IMT a unique opportunity to explore data from different sources to conduct research studies. The scientific results and the platform of Be-Safe will also provide teaching labs with the most advanced technology and applications to do research in this domain. In addition the project methodology and the technologies that will be implemented as well as the outputs will be used in the academic curriculum and syllabi.

div.head: Green communications
div.p: is an SME that wants to strongly reinforce its solution for the connection of any kind of terminal equipment (things, laptop, tablet, etc.) as part of the extension of 5G through D2D solutions and mesh networks. In particular, medical things will have to be connected on the Green participatory network with local treatments to lighten the transmissions to the 5G core network as much as possible. Green Communication hopes to commercialize its participatory network in medical environment.

UPEC will participate in this project as an academic partner. UPEC will improve the knowledge and experience of the researchers, and bringing together experts from industry and academia to exchange ideas and present results on advancing the state-of-the-art and overcoming research on the challenging issues related to Health^5G topics. The enrichment of the context of existing courses, as for instance, SDN control, or the introduction of new topics will also be an objective for UPEC. Additionally, further research topics can be originated by promoting MS and Ph.D. candidates and exploiting project results through its Master courses and its PhD programs as well. On the other hand, external exploitation of the results will include efforts for the dissemination of the results in prestigious conferences and journals and also participating in standards organization as ITU-T.

CHU Mondor-CEpiA Laboratory-UPEC High-level efforts are currently made at the international level in developing innovative care and management approaches for the elderly, that should ideally be centered on patients and enhance multidisciplinary collaboration between healthcare professionals. There are consequently great expectations from e-health solutions among both academic partners dedicated in building clinically useful and costeffective health interventions, and private partners (e.g. French Silver Valley) to create new market opportunities and partnerships. Thanks to its expertise and dual integration in hospital and primary care settings, CHU Mondor -CEpiA will further implement specific epidemiologic and clinical research studies that will stem from the developed platform to demonstrate its utility. As we believe findings from such studies will be highly scrutinized locally and internationally, dissemination of the model will be ensured through high quality scientific publications and communications in medical congress.

Highstreet technologies is already active in the telecommunications and data centre market. Indeed, highstreet technologies is developing software and providing professional services to mobile network operators as well as to companies running data centres. Based on the expertise gained in the eHealth^5G project, highstreet technologies will be able to enter the eHealth market with software applications and services. Moreover, this project will strengthen highstreet technologies' position in the telecommunications sector by its understanding of the vertical health market.

Fraunhofer IIS as a leading research institute will strengthen its position in designing, prototyping and testing of 4G and 5G cellular wireless systems by extending the functionality in the open source stack OpenAirInterface (4G/5G) and field testing. There is also a benefit for the public and industrial research community when this functionality of OpenAirInterface will be available for them. Despite, during the project, the 3GPP standardization activities will be closely monitored by IIS and the project results and recommendations will help to identify potential gaps and improvements in the wireless standards for usage of 4G/5G systems in eHealth applications. By joint or own publications, Fraunhofer IIS will be further increase its reputation for eHealth applications and also able to attract students for qualification thesis and as employees.

National Technical University of Ukraine (KPI) Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute is a research institution that closely collaborates with many IT, research and innovation companies as well as state institutions. E-Health development is a highly prioritize area for Ukrainian healthcare, and the Ministry of Healthcare of Ukraine is interested in results of the Health5G project. Exploitation will consist in using the practical results of the project for their implementation in national healthcare sector and specifically in development high-qualified medical support in the rural area.

div.head: Mälardalen University (MDH)
div.p: The exploitation activities at MDH involve integration of the Health^5G IoT platform with research results of other EU and national projects running at MDH: EU AAL CAMI, ESS-H, and ecare@home. MDH will also develop modules in Master and graduate education in the fields of network communications, advanced validation and verification, software engineering etc., by enriching the existing courses with the results and platform developed in Health^5G. The exploitation of the project's results in industry will be done via CNeT, Ericsson, etc., which are some of the companies with which MDH has extensive collaboration. The Health^5G results will be validated in different industrial settings and possibly deployed within such companies.

Alten is a service provider, supporting clients with products and solutions. I this project Alten will develop novel systems for next generation eHealth products and application. Alten has an interesting position in development and research as the partner has a central role in customers new products and solutions. Alten develops on demand communication devices as MedTech device but also push technolog in new directions. Alten has via its MedTech and Hotswap department a interesting track record on technology development. Hotswap is a large team that via its lab develops from issue to deployment. In this project the aim is to develop solutions to support eHealth pacients in the risk-zone from the sense of being less capable to focus on its own health and care. By adding improved interaction between stakeholders (pacients, doctors, health-care providers, pre-health activites, insurance, etc.). With support and help from the research in this project and hereby be able to provide new products such as devices, communication links and components, cloud-services, application, monitoring devices, etc. The exploitation plan is to develop these desired products and systems, and provided it to the community and customers. This explitaion goal concept is named by the partners as Predictive Health Care.

Accellrate is a small SME, with focus on communication components and solutions. They develop products for dedicated and personalized positioning for eHealth applications, both indoor as outdoor usage. The purpose of being part of this project is to develop the future position of Accellrate with respect of IoT devices and the Health domain. Thanks to their expertize on 3GPP and Wi-Fi technology they will be using sensors and devices in a connected scenario. The exploitation has focus on electronic mobile devices to track and help indivduals in danger in a health context. TUB (DAI-Labor) will participate in this project as a research institute. DAI Labor is one of the largest research laboratories of TUB. We have a huge profile of working on different large scale projects in different areas including: Health, mobile communication, eMobility, Security, etc. We have strong collaboration with Industry and research partners around the world in general and Europe in special e.g., Charite, Vivantes, Deutsche Telecom, Telefonica, Vodafone, Turkcell, Nokia, Huawei, are the few selected ones. With our standing and contacts we plan to introduce the outcome of the project to relevant industry partners and hospitals as a step towards digitization. As DAI Labor is involved in various other aspects of city digitization activites (e.g., www.diginet-ps.de for digitizing the road, etc.), the outcomes of the project will cover another dimension of city digitization i.e., health sector. We assume that the outcomes of this project will couple very well to our other activities and we will be able to provide better visibility by presenting different dimensions of city digitization. We also plan to exploit the results of the project for our further activities in the domain of eHealth and future network activities. In addition to these goals, we also integrate project's results to our courses and research publication.

Gasera will participate the project dissemination activities by promoting 5G-enabled instrumentation mobility in healthcare industry and beyond covering also other security-oriented industries, including e.g. automotive. Gasera will promote the project in its collaboration networks in Finland and globally covering multiple security-focused industries. Gasera will participate standardization work if possible, promoting instrument mobility over 5G networks.

VESTEL Electronics Vestel as a large consumer electronics and R&D company aims to derive benefits from this project through developed low-delay, real time e-Health services and applications powered by 5G network capabilities. Vestel as a manufacturer of smart TVs, Set-Top-Boxes and mobile devices, has plans to provide innovative home healthcare services seamlessly integrated into its consumer electronics products aligned with this project goals. Vestel will make use of this project's knowledge and vision in all its R&D projects where applicable. Research and development in this project, such as artificial intelligence, edge-computing, internet of things, and cloud connection and big data regarding to the health services and products will provide Vestel a competitive edge in healthcare and telemedicine market.

div.head: NUNSYS:
div.p: From the point of Nunsys the innovation achieved at the end of the project will consist on the new protocols and algorithms dealing with the security aspects in the context of the 5G eHealth environment. Particularly relevant will be those supporting the analysis of abnormal behavior patterns based on baseline comparison.

ESJU: It can be foreseen that in Health area there is huge opportunity for growth and new global business for Esju. We aim at expanding in this area with help of our excellent Telecommunications skills. Demonstration created in this project can be a door opener for Health markets. Furthermore, the solid company profiles in this project provide excellent opportunity for networking globally regarding future business. We aim at finding our market share with high end solutions as we are most well known as a company, which can tackle the toughest challenges. Main target is new international customer base for health business area. Project gives good insight to health business area.

Labrox: For Labrox the Goal for this project is to reach compatibility with 5G E-Health environments and to be able to integrate our future products in this type of workflow. With Point-Of-Care Testing and Digital Health being the fastest growing segments in the health care arena we see tremendous opportunity for our products to participate in this growth.

SemperTech has expertise in machine learning centric projects for private and public sector. We focus on cost prediction, IoT management and machine learning powered advanced cyber security systems. We currently have products of cyber security and a data analytics engine with meta-machine learning capabilities. We would like to contribute to predictive health analysis and security/privacy mechanisms of this project from design to implementation. We would like to enrich our know-how utilizing the output of this project. We expect to obtain patents and papers utilizing contribution to this project. We'll further develop our products fit-tailored to next generation health systems which will serve as a key point for next generation health service providers. We will bring our expertise in data analytics and cyber security through our products to the project and enhance them in accordance with the goals of our project. In particular, this project enables us to add new kind of prediction capabilities to our data analytics product. On cyber security side, we will enrich Cybernate through monitoring network and logs of devices which are physically distributed with respect to quality of service constraints of the running services in this project.

Ericsson Turkey. Currently Ericsson Turkey focuses on the deployment of different 5G use cases. As a result of this project, Ericsson Turkey likes to publish its achievements in different media resources. In the life-cycle of the Health^5G project, Ericsson Turkey will announce project's progess in the local media.
